title: How has customer service been evolving with revolutionizing technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: The revolution in technology has made customer service more outbound focused rather than inbound focused. In fact, customer service has changed so much due to new technology that building a culture centered around great customer service has made businesses realize how much value and revenue it can generate. Because customer service now has more access to data than ever before as well. Automation has made processes a lot more efficient so teams no longer have to help customers from a single source. With data, automation, and integrations, customer service is also no longer bound to a single team. Overall, customer service is no longer just a cost center but a revenue generating center for businesses. Being able to help customers, talk to customers, convert customers, and get better visibility into their behavior has made customer service a relationship building tool rather than a problem solving tool. Technologies such as pusher and socket based real time messaging has also broken customer service out of its natural habitat, email. Customers can now talk to businesses across social media, SMS, chat, etc. Customer service used to be, again, about inbound. Modern service is about inbound, outbound, education, and relationship building. These have implications for the tools that evolve to address these needs. Been in Customer Service for 13 years. Everyday, a customer service center works on about 15000++ requests and interacts with 9000++ customers. Every. Single. Day. Customer Service is a prime tool and is definitely continuously evolving in conjuction with the developments in technology. How? Customer Service generates actionable insights. Systems are made available in Customer Service, mainly to translate customer feedbackto monitor community reviewsto better understand customer buying patterns and market behaviorto predict or generate demandsto meet segment expectationsCustomer Service learn more rich insights over time to supply guidance that are helpful in making decisions which would improve a business’ product and service.
